add_label_ids.description: List of labels to add to the message

forward.description: Email address that the message should be forwarded to

remove_label_ids.description: List of labels to remove from the message

exclude_chats.description: Whether the response should exclude chats

from.description: The sender's display name or email address

has_attachment.description: Whether the message has any attachment

negated_query.description: Only return messages not matching the specified query. Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box. For example, "from:someuser@example.com rfc822msgid: is:unread"

query.description: Only return messages matching the specified query. Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box. For example, "from:someuser@example.com rfc822msgid: is:unread"

size.description: The size of the entire RFC822 message in bytes, including all headers and attachments

size_comparison.description: How the message size in bytes should be in relation to the size field. Acceptable values are: `larger` / `smaller` / `unspecified`

subject.description: Case-insensitive phrase found in the message's subject. Trailing and leading whitespace are be trimmed and adjacent spaces are collapsed

to.description: The recipient's display name or email address. Includes recipients in the "to", "cc", and "bcc" header fields. You can use simply the local part of the email address. For example, "example" and "example@" both match "example@gmail.com". This field is case-insensitive

background_color.description: The background color represented as hex string #RRGGBB (ex #000000). This field is required in order to set the color of a label. See https://developers.google.com/gmail/api/v1/reference/users/labels for more details

label_list_visibility.description: The visibility of the label in the label list in the Gmail web interface. Acceptable values are: `labelHide` / `labelShow` / `labelShowIfUnread`

message_list_visibility.description: The visibility of messages with this label in the message list in the Gmail web interface. Acceptable values are: `hide` / `show`

messages_total.description: The total number of messages with the label

messages_unread.description: The number of unread messages with the label

name.description: The display name of the label

text_color.description: The text color of the label, represented as hex string. This field is required in order to set the color of a label. See https://developers.google.com/gmail/api/v1/reference/users/labels for more details

threads_total.description: The total number of threads with the label

threads_unread.description: The number of unread threads with the label

type.description: The owner type for the label. User labels are created by the user and can be modified and deleted by the user and can be applied to any message or thread. System labels are internally created and cannot be added, modified, or deleted. System labels may be able to be applied to or removed from messages and threads under some circumstances but this is not guaranteed. For example, users can apply and remove the `INBOX` and `UNREAD` labels from messages and threads, but cannot apply or remove the `DRAFTS` or `SENT` labels from messages or threads

message_list_visibility.description: The visibility of messages with this label in the message list in the Gmail web interface. Acceptable values are: `hide` / `show`

messages_unread.description: The number of unread messages with the label

threads_unread.description: The number of unread threads with the label
